main_definition: A smaller group formed within a larger committee to focus on specific tasks or issues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A specialized group within a larger committee assigned to address particular aspects of the main committee's work.
meanings_and_examples.example: The finance subcommittee was tasked with reviewing and proposing changes to the budget.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An ad-hoc team created temporarily for specific projects or research within an organization or legislative body.
meanings_and_examples.example: A healthcare subcommittee was formed to investigate new policies on patient privacy rights.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A subgroup of a parent committee that operates semi-independently, often with its own agenda and responsibilities.
meanings_and_examples.example: The environmental subcommittee had the authority to enact regulations within their domain without needing approval from the main committee.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An entity that reports back to a larger group, providing specialized insights or recommendations based on focused research.
meanings_and_examples.example: The technology subcommittee presented its findings and suggested improvements for integrating AI into existing systems.
